title: unknown calligraphic typeface
content:
what's the name of this calligraphic typeface?

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [calligraphy-unknown-typeface.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20131021072719/http:/typophile.com/files/calligraphy-unknown-typeface.png) | 11.26 KB |
author: ghurman

comments.content:
Could be hand-lettered. Unfortunately, there are no duplicate letters that might help prove this either way. It doesn't look familiar to me, for what that's worth.

- Mike Yanega

[EF La Salle](http://web.archive.org/web/20131021072719/http:/www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=EFT0000495), [Scriptorama Tradeshow](http://web.archive.org/web/20131021072719/http:/www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=JBT0000047) and [Coffee Service](http://web.archive.org/web/20131021072719/http:/www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=UMT0000404) have a similar feel but not exact. My initial thought was that it was from a Sign Lettering foundry like 'Sign DNA' but I couldn't pin it down.

Note: Searched all of the scripts on Sign DNA, Letterhead Fonts and Veer. Nada.
